The Enhanced Background Checks Act, H.R. 2403, to close the ‚ÄúCharleston Loophole‚Äù that allows an individual to purchase firearms before approval of their background check after 3 days. 

These bills take concrete action to protect our kids, our communities, & our country.

The Bipartisan Background Checks Act, H.R. 715, to require a background check for every firearm sale w/ certain exemptions for family transfers & temporary hunting transfers. 

This will prevent firearms from getting into the wrong hands through unlicensed dealers.

The Assault Weapons Ban, H.R. 698, to prohibit the sale, transfer, manufacture & importation of semiautomatic weapons.

These weapons of war have been used in some of the deadliest mass shootings in the United States & do not belong on our streets.

This bipartisan bill would make sure that existing background check laws meant to keep guns out of the hands of dangerous individuals are enforced ‚Äî including for sales made online or at gun shows. (2/3)

TODAY, I signed a discharge petition to force the Bipartisan Background Checks Act to the floor of the U.S. House.

Even if @SpeakerMcCarthy objects.

Because loopholes SHOULD NOT allow criminals and those with a history of violence to have unfettered access to guns. (1/3)

This bill specifies the types of weapons that are manufactured for the efficient killing of people ‚Äî while exempting more than 2,200 guns that are used for hunting, home defense, or recreation.

A new Assault Weapons Ban is an overdue, commonsense step to save lives. (3/3)

When a federal Assault Weapons Ban was in place from 1994 until 2004, gun massacres dropped by nearly 40%.

Once this ban expired, gun massacres increased by 183%.

Americans of all ages have since been slaughtered at school, church, concerts, grocery stores, night clubs. (2/3)

Weapons designed to inflict maximum casualties DO NOT belong on our streets.

This bill is the Assault Weapons Ban. (1/3)

Travelers who want to visit D.C. face the most expensive domestic ticket prices compared to other major markets because of limited competition. The #DCAAct will help alleviate that pressure on consumers & the flying public & would increase slots across all carriers equally.

DCA remains the only airport in the country that is still bound by this outdated federal
regulation that caps the number of flights farther than 1,250 miles. By limiting flights, we are squeezing consumers ‚Äìit‚Äôs our constituents who are paying the price.

With few exceptions, the perimeter rule limits the distance that incoming & outgoing flights can travel at DCA to no more than 1,250 miles. This rule is making travel to the D.C. region more expensive & less convenient for consumers, businesses, & communities.

Congress restricted air traffic at DCA in the 1960s ‚Äî in part to encourage airlines to grow their long-distance flight options from the then-newly built Washington Dulles airport that had just been built in then-rural Virginia ‚Äî by creating perimeter rule limits.

Today, I introduced the Direct Capital Access Act alongside my colleague, @RepBurgessOwens. This bill seeks to add 14 in- and beyond-perimeter flights at DCA in the 2023 FAA Reauthorization bill. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FyiaC4UXoAUgGlY.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FyiaC4WXoAAaIft.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FyiaC4XWAAIJNz0.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FyiaC4VXgAI5j5m.jpg
